titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ray Benson Accessions
titlestmt.author: Tabitha Henderson (2017, 2018) and Sherri Turner-Herrmann (2019, 2020)

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-07-28 10:26:31 -0500.

change.item: Revised for ArchivesSpace by Sherri Turner-Herrmann.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Ray Benson Accessions

physdesc.extent: Framed items, posters, composite photograph, awards, artifacts

did.abstract: Ray Benson's archive contains materials documenting his entire career, featuring records, photographs, instruments, wardrobe, awards and other memorabilia dating from 1951-2018.
did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site. Advance notice is required for use: https://www.thewittliffcollections.txstate.edu/research/makearesearchappointment.html.

bioghist.head: Biographical Notes
bioghist.p: In a career that has spanned almost half a century, Benson has established himself as the modern king of Western Swing by being the driving force behind Asleep at the Wheel. In 1970 the Philadelphia-born Benson co-founded the band in Paw Paw, West Virginia along with Lucky Oceans and Leroy Preston. The band relocated to the Bay Area in 1971 upon the urging of musician Commander Cody, whose own band The Lost Planet Airmen was gaining prominence on the West Coast. Asleep at the Wheel quickly attracted fans, one of which was legendary rock and soul artist, Van Morrison. Soon after Morrison mentioned the band in an interview with Rolling Stone magazine, Asleep at the Wheel were offered a record contract by United Artists, and in 1973 their first album "Comin' Right At Ya" was released.
Not long after that, the "cosmic cowboys" of Texas came calling, and on the advice of artists like Willie Nelson and Doug Sahm, Benson moved the band to Austin. The rest, as they say, is history.

Benson's honors include 2011 Texan of the Year, 2011 Texas Medal of the Arts Award for Multimedia, the 2009 Lifetime Achievement Award from the Americana Music Association, the 2008 TEC Les Paul Award, and the official Texas State Musician in 2004. He's also an actor, writer and voice-over talent. A much sought after producer, he has worked with such artists as Willie Nelson, Aaron Neville, Aaron Watson and Suzy Bogguss, to name a few. Since 2010 Benson has hosted the highly successful "Texas Music Scene" television series which broadcasts weekly all across the country, showcasing live performances by today's talent in the Texas and Red Dirt music circuit. Benson has also hosted the radio show "Austin Outer Limits" on Sirius/XM's "Willie's Roadhouse" channel.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ray Benson Accessions, The Wittliff Collections, Texas State University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ray Benson's archive contains materials documenting his entire career, featuring records, photographs, instruments, wardrobe, awards and other memorabilia dating from 1951-2018.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials from the Wittliff Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. The user assumes responsibility for determining copyright status, obtaining permission to publish, and abiding by U.S. copyright laws. https://www.thewittliffcollections.txstate.edu/research/visit/policies/publication.html

did.unittitle: Accession 2018-025

scopecontent.head: Abstract
scopecontent.p: The Ray Benson archive includes material documenting Benson's music career from 1971-2017. Majority of the collection includes promotional articles, including an article from John Morthland; and awards. Included in the collection are photographs of Benson with President George W. Bush, Laura Bush, and others; Benson's boots and concert jacket; and correspondence with Dolly Parton and others. The folder titles preceding a semicolon reflect Benson's original descriptions.

scopecontent.head: Abstract
scopecontent.p: Archival materials donated by musician, Ray Benson, as additions to his collection following his music career from 1957-2015. Majority of the addition are photographs of Asleep at the Wheel and headshots of Benson; news clippings and magazine articles on Asleep at the Wheel; and concert promotional materials such as posters and flyers. Included in the collection are handwritten song lyrics; Benson's guitar, cowboy hat, and concert shirt; and photographs of Benson with former U.S. Presidents Bill Clinton, George W. Bush, and Barack Obama.

Accession 2019-128

scopecontent.head: Abstract
scopecontent.p: Archival materials donated by Ray Benson, lead singer of the iconic Western Swing band Asleep at the Wheel dating 1972-2018. Additions to this archive include awards, articles and press clippings pertaining to Ray Benson and Asleep at the Wheel from national and international newspapers and magazines both print and online, press kit materials, photographs, tour itineraries, celebrity endorsements by Ray Benson and ephemera. The majority of press includes Asleep at the Wheel album reviews including 10, Asleep at the Wheel Tribute to the Music of Bob Wills and the Texas Playboys, and Asleep at the Wheel Remembers the Alamo, Grammy, CMA, and BMI nominations and awards for Asleep at the Wheel, AATW Billboard album and single chart positions, movie reviews of Wild Texas Rose co-starring Dolly Parton, Ray Benson and Gary Busey, and reviews of A Ride With Bob: From Austin to Tulsa, A Musical Drama About the Life and Legend of Bob Wills written by Ann Rapp and Ray Benson and starring Ray Benson and Asleep at the Wheel. Ephemera includes Ray Benson's childhood passport, his chauffeur license and date books, concert posters and record flats.

Majority of press pertains to Asleep at the Wheel's album Asleep at the Wheel Remembers the Alamo and the movie The Alamo co-starring Billy Bob Thornton

"Press 2006/2007"; Articles, press clippings and album reviews pertaining to Asleep at the Wheel and Ray Benson from various newspapers, newsletters, music trade magazines both online outlets and print

"Asleep at the Wheel Press 1987"; Articles, press clippings, Billboard album chart listings, album reviews, radio station rotation lists and correspondence pertaining to Asleep at the Wheel and Ray Benson from various newspapers and magazines. Includes Asleep at the Wheel's CMA nomination for Vocal Group of the Year

"Asleep at the Wheel Press 1987"; Articles, press clippings, Billboard album chart listings, album reviews pertaining to Asleep at the Wheel and Ray Benson from various newspapers and magazines, 1987. Includes Asleep at the Wheel's CMA nomination for Vocal Group of the Year

"Asleep at the Wheel Press 1988"; Articles, press clippings, Billboard album chart listings, album reviews and correspondence pertaining to Asleep at the Wheel and Ray Benson from various newspapers and magazines, 1988-1989. Includes press relating to Asleep at the Wheel's Best Country Instrumental Grammy award for "String of Pars" from their album 10. File 1 of 2

"Asleep at the Wheel Press 1988"; Articles, press clippings, Billboard album chart listings, album reviews and correspondence pertaining to Asleep at the Wheel and Ray Benson from various newspapers and magazines. Includes press relating to Asleep at the Wheel's Best Country Instrumental Grammy award for "String of Pars" from their album 10

"Asleep at the Wheel Press 1989"; Drawings articles, press clippings, Billboard chart listings, album reviews and radio station chart lists pertaining to Asleep at the Wheel and Ray Benson from various newspapers and magazines (national and international Includes press relating to Asleep at the Wheel's Best Country Instrumental Grammy nomination for "Sugarfoot Rag". File 1 of 2

"Asleep at the Wheel Press 1989"; Articles, press clippings, Billboard chart listings, album reviews and radio station chart lists pertaining to Asleep at the Wheel and Ray Benson from various newspapers and magazines (national and international. Includes press relating to Asleep at the Wheel's Best Country Instrumental Grammy nomination for "Sugarfoot Rag". File 2 of 2

"2000 + Random Old"; Articles, press clippings, Billboard chart listings, album reviews pertaining to Asleep at the Wheel and Ray Benson from various newspapers and magazines Includes press related to Asleep at the Wheel's Bob Wills tribute album A Ride with Bob and the band's 6 Grammy nominations for 2006

"A Ride With Bob Press 2005"; Articles, press clippings, correspondence and reviews from various newspapers, newsletters and magazines both print and online pertaining to the play A Ride With Bob: from Austin to Tulsa written by Ray Benson and Anne Rapp

"AATW Forget-Me-Nots: Posters and Flyers"; Correspondence to/from and about Ray Benson and Asleep at the Wheel, Stoney Plain (RCA) record catalog, bios, news clippings "AATW Forget-Me-Nots: Posters and Flyers"; Correspondence to/from and about Ray Benson and Asleep at the Wheel, Stoney Plain (RCA) record catalog, bios, news clippings Includes 1976 CMA Seminar proceedings and 1979 Grammy winner list.

"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Ray Benson product endorsements for Golfsmith golf clubs and Samick guitars, Homespun Tapes instructional video catalog which includes guitar instructional tape with Ray Benson

"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Award certificates including The Academy Of Western Artists Will Rogers Cowboy Award, Western Swing Society Hall of Fame, Country Music Association Instrumental Group of the Year finalist, True West Best Living Western Music Group presented to Ray Benson and Asleep at the Wheel

"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Regional performing arts programs including The Kennedy Center Texas Festival, University of Texas, Austin, and the Maine Center for the Performing Arts, Melody Fair Theater
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Music festival programs including the Long Beach Blues Festival, Philadelphia Jam on the River and the Singer-Songwriter Festival Frutigen Switzerland
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Funeral service program for Eugene "Gene" Ramey
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Vince Gill Celebrity Basketball Game and Concert programs
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Photographs of Ray Benson and Asleep at the Wheel
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Correspondence to Ray Benson
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Country Gold Music International Country Music Festival, Kumamoto, Japan itineraries, 1 copy of The Country: Japanese Country Music Magazine Vol.2
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; George Strait Chevy Truck Music Festival itinerary, Asleep at the Wheel long term itinerary
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Asleep at the Wheel press kit materials, photos, bios, calendar. Includes 25th anniversary materials
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Asleep at the Wheel concert flyers
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; As The Wheel Turns newsletters, Capitol International newsletter, Barton Creek Newsletter, ACM Country Focus newsletter

"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Articles, press clippings and reviews pertaining to Asleep at the Wheel and Ray Benson from various newspapers and magazines including The New York Times, USA Today, Austin American Statesman, Philadelphia Inquirer, Washington Post, American Way, Country Weekly and Country Song
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; The Austin Chronicle, Vol. 17, No. 4 with Ray Benson on cover

"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Awards ceremony programs: Technical Excellence and Creativity Awards, and The 1996 Governor's Award Tribute Honoring Lyle Lovett Hosted by Ray Benson and Ann Richards
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; NARAS Grammy Awards – Programs and final nominations 18th, 30th, 38th – 40th annual ceremonies
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; BMI Country Music Awards programs
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; 14th Annual Country Music Association Awards Show: The Official Yearbook and Guide
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; The Rhythm & Blues Foundation 8th and 9th Annual Pioneer Awards programs, 8th Annual Pioneer Awards discography
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Academy of Country Music 29th Annual Awards ceremony program
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Showbiz Weekly Las Vegas entertainment magazine. Article on Asleep at the Wheel, pg. 61

"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Country Music International Fan Fair Nashville, Tennessee program, Liberty Records and Patriot Records host, Ray Benson, pg. 12, 70th anniversary of the Grand Old Opry, pg. 63
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; 1991 Texas Inauguration program, Ann Richards, Governor. Gala performers Asleep at the Wheel

"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; The Long Center for the Performing Arts, Austin, Texas grand opening bound photo album inscribed "Ray, Thanks for making this a magical weekend. Love ya Bobbie T."
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Commemorative plaque "Still The King" with Ray Benson Texan Theater Thank You Ray! Bob Wills Heritage Foundation Bob Wills Fiddle Festival and Concert

"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Plaque presented to Ray Benson by Texas State University, San Marcos, Texas for "Studies in Entrepreneurship Visiting Entrepreneur", presented by College of Business Administration
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Award presented to Asleep at the Wheel by the Country Music Association for Awards Finalist for Vocal Group of the Year, framed

"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Ephemera 1. Two tickets to the 32nd Annual Grammy Awards 2. United States of America Passport for Ray Benson Seifert, 3. Texas Department of Public Safety chauffer license for Ray Benson Seifert, 4. Monthly date book, 5. Spiral bound Weekly Minder, 6. Smithsonian Institution membership card for Ray Seifert, 7. D.A. Weibring A.R.C. Pro/AM contestant button for Ray Benson, 8. Asleep at the Wheel Bob Wills Tribute Tour "94" guest pass, 9. NARAS Trustees Meeting VIP pass, 10. Outdoor Junction Concert, Montana Asleep at the Wheel ticket, 11. Official 3 Stooges Fan Club membership certificate for Ray Benson
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Western Swing Music Hall of Fame induction award presented to Ray Benson, lucite music note mounted on wooden base
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; B&W, 11.5 x 14.5 photograph of Ray Benson on outdoor stage
"Old Press 1972-1997"; Country Music Association Citation of Merit presented to Asleep at the Wheel as a finalist in the Annual Country Music Awards for Instrumental Group of the Year

"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Special Citation of Achievement presented by BMI to Paw Paw Music for 1 million broadcast performances for "My Baby Thinks He's a Train". Includes correspondence from Frances W. Preston, President & CEO of BMI
"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Billboard: The International Newsweekly of Music, Video and Home Entertainment, 100th Anniversary Issue 1894-1994 Special Collector's Edition

"Old-Newsletters, Press kits, Photos"; Posters and record flats 1. Asleep at the Wheel 10 album cover bi-fold record flat, Epic Records, 2. Don Walser Down at the Sky-Vue Drive-in record flat, Sire Records, 3. Asleep At The Wheel Tribute to the Music of Bob Wills and The Texas Playboys record flat, Liberty Records, 4. 98.1 KVET radio station birthday poster for Ray Benson, "Saluting a Genuine Texas Original…Happy Birthday Ray!", 5.
